item.title: Product innovation insights
item.description:
Notes on Product innovation

Cross function teamwork

  • Marketing
  • Designer
  • Engineer
  • Quality control
  • Procurement
  • Supply chain
  • Consumer care

Product design

  1. Know your customers
  2. Product concepts vs business opportunities
  3. Validated value propositions
    1. Market size
    2. Unique selling points

Tools to discover user experience

  • user profile
    • Cover as much as possible
  • Experience map
    • Discover pains, gains, identify product and business opportunities
  • Value proposition map
    • Value of product or service vs user needs
  • Two ways of innovation
    • Market push (Most case)
      • Observe market needs then come up with solutions
    • Technology push
      • Have technology first and do other way around to make it success
      • Have to work on convincing

Converting concepts into product requirements

  • Define product specifications
  • Ensure all products specifications can be traced back to user needs
  • Ensure completeness of product specs
  • Avoid over spec

Tools

  • V-Model
    • Verification and validation
  • Competitors analysis
    • Know their products inside out
  • Critical to quality tree
    • Link consumer needs with product specification
  1. Need
    1. Eg. I want a good coffee
  2. Drivers
    1. E.g. Taste, Temperature, Cost
  3. CTQs
    1. E.g. not acidic, rich in flavour

Product development

Methods of user research

  • usability study
    • Easy to observe
    • Fast
    • But not for long term usage data collect
  • Product in home use test
    • Reliable user experience data based on long term
    • Help to identify potential quality issues
    • But takes time with high cost
  • Testing groups
    • Potential users
    • Expert groups

Post market surveillance

  • Timely monitor consumer feedback
  • Collect market feedback
    • Ratings and reviews
      • User scores and reviews online
      • Impact on purchasing intent
    • Consumer research

User research

  • Data being analysed for decision making purpose
  • Important factors
    • Authentic
    • Representativeness
    • Reliability
  • methodology
    • Interview
    • Focus group discussion
    • Field observation
    • Questionnaire
    • Product testing
    • Big data
    • And moreâ€¦

Key to successful product innovation

  • Data based decision making
  • Continuously collect feedback through user research and testing
  • Define product requirements and specs accordingly to consumers’ biggest needs
  • Thorough understanding of market and needs
  • Iterative design process for optimum product design
